pageContext.description:
Portrait of Johann Ernst, Prince of Saxony (1521-1553) as half length figure, facing left.
[cda 2015]
pageContext.dimensions:
Dimensions of support: 55 x 50.5 x 1.1 cm 
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 154]
pageContext.inscription:
- at the top right:
'Ioannes Ernestus/ Dux Saxoniae'
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 154]

involvedPersons.suffix: Follower of Lucas Cranach the Elder

pageContext.markings:
Reverse
on the frame:
- Duke Ernst's brandmark 'E (with a crown) Cap: XI, NO 60'
- remnants of an oval adhesive label 'No. 33'
on the panel (clockwise from the the top centre):
- adhesive label 'No 102'
- adhesive label KVC
- adhesive label HKA
- adhesive label with an inscription: 'Johann Ernestus Chur. Fürst Johann/Fridrichs bruder oheim Euer Gnaden'
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 154]

pageContext.provenance:
- ducal property, Ehrenburg castle
- 1856 Ducal Art and Antiquities Collection, Coburg (Herzogliche Kunst- und Altertümersammlung der Veste Coburg (HKA))
- 1919 Kunstsammlungen der Veste Coburg (KVC)

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
Varnish:
- the painting exhibits a glossy coat of varnish; recent retouches are visible.
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 154]

tests.text:
Identification of wood species: alder wood (Alnus sp.)

Alder wood was also identified as the wood employed for the two panels depicting saints in Karlsruhe: [DE_SKK_0110] and [DE_SKK_0113]

[Klein report, 03.03.2016]

- fir wood

- chamfered on all four sides, width of chamfer 1.5 cm, the reverse exhibits toolmarks from a toothed plane 

- to vertically aligned planks, plank widths (recto, from the right): plank I: 26.2 cm; plank II: 24 cm

pageContext.signature:
Artist's insignia at the top right: serpent with elevated wings, signed beneath with the monogram 'HS' (linked), beneath that '1.5.20'
[Cat. Coburg 2018, 154]
